title: The time is wrong any app or site I use on Firefox.
content: I have tried syncing to the time server and manually updating the time with no success. It is only happening on this computer. My other laptop and my Android are fine, so it has something to do with something on this PC. I've tried to disable vpns but that hasn't helped. Any insight is greatly appreciated since the timestamp is crucial for much of what I do!
creator: pete.theodore1

title: Firefox 115.0.2, Google search, space bar, cursor movement.
content:
Pressing the space bar in google search "https://www.google.com" using Firefox 115.0.2 as the browser, with the cursor at the start/Beginning of the search box, will not move the cursor at all" 'Example', wanting to add a new word in front of a previously typed search term, thus having to type the new word/s in front of the previously typed word, then place the cursor in between the new and old co-joined search terms, then press the space bar to add a space between the words.

Pushing the space bar with the cursor in front of any previously typed search term or in an empty search box, using Google as the search engine but using other browsers (tested on Edge, Chrome, Opera and previous versions of Firefox) will move the cursor one space, or if the space bar is held down, the cursor will move from one side of the search box to the other.

This behavior also does not occur using other search engines, with Firefox 115.0.2 as the browser (tested on Bing, Duckduckgo, Startpage, Lycos, Yandex.). So I am not sure if this is a Firefox or a Google issue, or is somehow combined between the two.

Operating system "Windows 10"
creator: quickgoanna

title: We'd like to talk to you about new translation features
content: Translations have been added in this beta version of Firefox. I was wondering if there are any plans to add Korean translations. I'm also wondering if the added translations are Mozilla's own creations, or if they are imported from other external sites.
creator: tldbs321

title: Firefox 115.0.2 and T-Mobile
content:
I upgraded to Firefox 115.0.2. Now I can log into my T-Mobile account. But when I try to access 'Bill & Pay' or 'View Accounts' I now get "Access Restricted" error messages. This is frustrating as I was able to do so before. Clearing Cookies and Site Data provided no relief. T-Mo support had me try in in Private Browsing, and it works.

I had an issue with a bank, and turned off AVG Anti-Track and it work. But no so with T-Mo.

What the heck is wrong?
creator: j.j.lynn04

title: containers addon window size
content: containers addon doesnt fit to the window size i couldnt find in settings, in config files or in anywhere to set it if the user has multiply containers the length of list of the containers is blocking the manage containers button which is at the bottom of the menu? additionally i couldnt find any option to open the addon (any, not just the containers) in a new window in order to manage it, since it could directly solve it... (i have searched whole of the browser s current profile directory and even about:config -[since i am not any web browser programmer maybe i have missed it but nothing, no way to open any addon in a new window interactively unless it hasnt been built by this way] how will a user use it with more then 4 profiles? it doesnt scroll till to the manage containers button!) what should we do Thanks
creator: freezejet

title: Can not log in to Firefox account
content: Hello, I have two Firefox Accounts related to my email addresses of 'rod@thejones.org' and 'rodjones@thejones.org' In fact, they are really both the same email address and an alias. Other alias' for the email are rhubarb@thejones.org and rocket@thejones.org. Please find the attached 39 bytes rod@thejones.org Firefox Recovery Key.txt file dated 9/08/2020 10:45AM: A7AV WDQ7 K8NA EHR9 BWCP JAKW 866A BZRD Because of confusion on my part on how all this is supposed to fit together, I no longer have access to my original secure Firefox login for rod@thejones.org because I deleted the google authenticator app for that login. My google authenticator app for rodjones@thejones.org is still working Ok. Easiest solution to this whole mess is to delete my original account for rod@thejones.org and I'll continue to use my rodjones@thejones.org Would you please either link my secure signin to rodjones@thejones.org with rod@thejones.org, or delete the secure signin for rod@thejones.org. If you send an email to rod@thejones.org requesting approval to delete that account, I will respond accordingly.
creator: rodjones1
